I would highly recommend Young Frankenstein, a classic comedy horror film directed by Mel Brooks and released in 1974.

The movie revolves around a genetics experiment conducted by Dr. Frankenstein (played by Kenneth Mars) with the help of his assistant, Igor (played by Madeline Kahn)).

The experiment results in the creation of an artificial man (played by Peter Boyle)) named Ben (played by John Heard)).

Ben is unaware that he is an artificial man and believes that he was born normal.

Based on the user's preferences and the information provided, I would recommend the movie "Flags of Our Fathers" (2000).

This movie tells the life stories of six men who raised the flag at the Battle of Iwo Jima during World War II.

The main actors in this movie are Paul Walker and Joseph Cross, who played the roles of Private First Class James Dwyer,Private First Class Leonard Smith,Private First Class Richard Schmidling,Private First Class Thomas Jordan, and Private First Class William Jordan, respectively.

Overall, "Flags of Our Fathers" is a well-made film that tells an important story about the bravery and sacrifice of soldiers during times of war.
